  • Items
  • "Communings with Nature, Night"

Download PDF View on Timeline
Title:
"Communings with Nature, Night"
Author:
Grace Aguilar
Date Created:
1844
Description:
"Night" explores the profound and spiritual essence of the nocturnal world. Through vivid imagery of diverse landscapes, from American forests to the African desert, the poem contemplates how night reveals divine truths and offers solace to the soul. Ultimately, it posits night as a sacred time for introspection and a pathway to understanding a higher power's unchanging love and rest.
Subjects:
Nature--Poetry English--literature--Jewish authors
Language:
English
Location:
Philadelphia
Publisher:
Occident and American Jewish Advocate (Periodical)
Source Identifier:
vjwp_193
Type:
poem
Format:
pdf
Relation:
In Occident and American Jewish Advocate, vol. 2, no. 1, Apr. 1844, pp. 22-6.
Source
Preferred Citation:

Reference Link:

Victorian Jewish Writers Project

Welcome to the Victorian Jewish Writers Project, a digital collection focusing on Anglo-Jewish writing during the long nineteenth century. The site is a work-in-progress, so please contact katzir [at] vjwp [dot] org if you need one-on-one assistance.
